narratives.description:
Technical support managers supervise a company's technical support. They must provide their team with strong leadership and direction to increase productivity. Being able to resolve the issues of customers and employees, being able to motivate a team, and being able to identify problems and recommend improvements to technical support processes are vital. 
Strong computer skills, leadership traits, and technical accreditations are a must for technical support managers, as is an ability to troubleshoot problems, think critically, and come up with solutions to a wide array of technological service issues as they arise. Familiarity with software and hardware troubleshooting, service, and repair is a must. 
In general, technical support managers must be familiar with technical support industry standards and practices, and they must have worked in technical support roles in the past.
narratives.summaryHourly: The average pay for a Technical Support Manager is $24.78 per hour.
narratives.summarySalary: The average pay for a Technical Support Manager is $85,778 per year.

tasks: Perform analyses, create reports, and implement emergency plans.
Participate in root cause analysis and communicate findings to customers.
Prioritize projects, identify goals, determine budget, and assign staff to reach goals.
Oversee daily operations, including schedules, escalations, and reporting.
Maintain performance metrics and survey targets for quality service delivery.

occupationalDetails.skills: People Management, Customer Service, Information Technology (IT) Support, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), IT Management, Operations Management, Project Management, Windows Operating System General Use, Team Leadership, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Word, Product Support, Technical Analysis, Troubleshooting, Microsoft SQL Server, Windows NT / 2000 / XP Networking, Microsoft Exchange, HTML, Training, Team Management, Data Analysis, SQL, Cisco Networking, Electronic Troubleshooting, Internet Information Server (IIS), Customer Service Metrics, Linux, Product Development, Network Management / Administration, Microsoft Active Directory, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Microsoft Excel, Root Cause Analysis, Salesforce, Network Support, Systems Troubleshooting, Support Management, Software Installation & Upgrade, Strategic Planning, Performance Management, Manufacturing Process Engineering, Customer Relations, Help Desk / Desktop Support (Tier 2), Process Improvement, Sales Engineering, Strategic Project Management, Software as a Service (SaaS), Technical Services, Training Program Development, VMware ESX, Windows Support, Training Management, System Administration, Tech Support Call Center, Technical Sales, Software Development, Hiring, Microsoft Access, IT Security & Infrastructure, Leadership, Help Desk / Desktop Support, Product Management
